snippet: A work stoppage has entered its second week, challenging François Hollande’s attempt to steer his Socialist Party on a more centrist path.
abstract: National railway strike in France has stranded thousands and exasperated millions more, including high school students trying to reach their nationwide graduation test sites; strike is seen as a crucial test of Pres Francois Hollande to hang tough in face of criticism from left-leaning opposition, especially labor unions, and ensuing strains in his Socialist Party.

byline.contributor: Maïa de la Baume contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A work stoppage has entered its second week, challenging François Hollande’s attempt to steer his Socialist Party on a more centrist path.

headline.main: Rail Strike Strands French and Tests Their President
headline.print_headline: Rail Strike Strands French and Tests Their President

keywords.value: SNCF (Societe Nationale des Chemins de fer Francais)
keywords.name: organizations
